About Me

Let me tell you how this Filmmaker became a Software Developer...

BIO

Hello! My name is Darric Alexander a Full Stack Web Developer. While in college I tried coding out for fun. At that moment it was another creative outlet I fell in love with. After graduation I decided to place film on hold and pursue Software Development. I enrolled in the fast-paced Full Stack Developer program with the University of Arizona. I enjoy working front and back end, but my interest are highly with the Front End. I enjoy the challenges of coming up with creative designs, thinking in a UI/UX mindset and working with React.js, Bootstrap and Sass. My background is in Marketing and Banking. Having a strong Marketing background I like to apply that when thinking of how the consumer will interact with the web and mobile applications I'm creating. Please take a look at my portfolio and see the growth I've made. I truly enjoy learning and wish to pursue learning more about web/software development, with Machine Learning and AI.

University of Arizona Web Development

Student

Enrolled in fully immersed coding bootcamp with the University of Arizona. We trained on the M.E.R.N. stack which encompasses MongoDB, Express.JS, React.JS and Node.JS. This enabled me to fully understand how to create full stack web applications from scratch. We worked on testing, debugging and code optimization. Our focus was on the JavaScript language and all of its libraries and frameworks.

AAM, LLC

Homeowner Associate

Project Management support — Assist Executive team with quality control of each project as it passes through various phases (i.e., schedule and track marketing and business development activities and provide analytic reports), proactively update lead database and pricing matrix, coordinate mailing lists and maintenance of contact database and/or spreadsheets. Research — assist with conducting competitive intelligence and market research in preparation for presentations, proposals and other business development initiatives; conduct market research and collect data regarding industry organizations, publications, seminars, forums and other related marketing opportunities. Followed strict guidelines for each community while assisting Board Members, Community Management, Administration and Community Attorneys.

Arizona Federal Credit Union

Loan Consultant

Reviewed loan documents submitted, including analysis of credit, income, assets and any other liability documentation. Calculate risk of loans, carefully following lending guidelines. Experienced in pulling credit reports from Transunion, Equifax and Experian. Remain up to date with all new compliance changes related to Bank Secrecy Act and Anti-Money Laundering up to and including the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), NCUA, FDIC, etc. Includes, accurate and timely processing of consumer and mortgage loan payment corrections, modifications, and payoff requests, due date changes, subordination requests, recording and releasing of Deeds of Trust.
